column4: hi everyone. I'm working on a research paper about ubuntu for university. Since i'm not super familiar with linux I thought I could pick some brains here. My first question is... on a default install I have 3 partitions. One is ext3 which is fine, the next is linux swap which is fine but i'm trying to figure out what the regular ext one is for that is almost the same size as the linux swap partition. Any suggestions?
by default there are two partitions: / and swap
you might be talking about /boot however...
